0.title: Parents beg after hospital staffer allegedly asks for ₹50,000 for son's body in Bihar
0.article_body: Parents of a youth in Bihar were seen begging to collect money to get the mortal remains of their son from Sadar Hospital after a hospital employee allegedly asked for ₹50,000 to release the body. "We're poor people, how can we pay this amount?" the deceased's father said. "Action will be taken if any employee is found guilty," official said.

1.title: Adivi starts Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan fund for CDS, NDA aspirants
1.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh has announced a fund in the name of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan. The fund will provide guidance, training and funding for CDS (Combined Defence Services examination) and NDA (National Defence Academy) aspirants across the country. "I'm going to start the fund and will incorporate the help of some more friends as well as actors," Adivi stated.

2.title: 3 PFI activists arrested over Kanpur violence, 54 arrests made so far
2.article_body: UP Police arrested three Popular Front of India (PFI) activists in connection with Kanpur violence. A total of 54 arrests have been made, police said. The three activists were previously arrested during anti-CAA protests in 2019, Kanpur Police Commissioner Vijay Singh Meena added. Violence broke out in Kanpur on Friday following former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

3.title: US House votes to raise age to buy semi-automatic weapons to 21
3.article_body: The US House of Representatives has passed a bill seeking to raise the minimum age to buy semi-automatic weapons from 18 years to 21. The bill, passed by 223-204 votes, also calls for banning sale of ammunition magazines that can carry over 15 rounds. This comes days after deadly shooting incidents in Texas, New York and Oklahoma.

4.title: Had no film sets, shot at live locations; was challenging: 'Khuda...' director
4.article_body: Faruk Kabir, director of 'Khuda Haafiz Chapter 2: Agni Pariksha', said that the team shot for the movie at live locations. "We did face a lot of challenges...there were no sets. The film has been shot very honestly without any gimmickry. That's always a challenging task," he said, adding that there was no body double for actor Vidyut Jammwal.

5.title: CISF constable found dead at rented apartment; suicide suspected
5.article_body: A 30-year-old Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) constable posted at the Pune International Airport was found dead at his rented apartment in Pune. "Primary probe points to it being a case of suicide. We've launched a probe into the sequence of events leading to...death and the reason for him taking the extreme step," senior police inspector Bharat Jadhav said.

6.title: Hrithik loved the original, was 1st to call us: 'Vikram...' co-maker
6.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' co-director Gayatri revealed that Hrithik Roshan loved the original Tamil film, which featured R Madhavan and Vijay Sethupathi. "He was the first actor to call us after its release...we were at a wedding at that time," she added. Gayatri further stated Hrithik is "extremely down to earth". "If we didn't agree, he didn't have a problem," she added.

7.title: What is Kejriwal's compulsion to save Satyendar Jain?: Anurag Thakur
7.article_body: After Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by ED in an alleged money laundering case, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is enacting "drama" over ED’s action. "The charges are very serious and one wonders what is Kejriwal's compulsion in saving Satyendar Jain...Will you only make false allegations to demoralise the investigating agencies?" Thakur asked.

8.title: BSF fires at drone near international border in J&K's Arnia
8.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) troops fired at a drone spotted near the international border in Jammu and Kashmir's Arnia sector on Thursday morning. The drone that was flying at a height of around 300 metres returned back due to the firing, the BSF said. Officials said that the drone activity was from Pakistan.

9.title: I learnt the meaning, value of dal, roti at a young age: Suniel Shetty
9.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he learnt the meaning and value of dal and roti at a young age after being introduced to his father's restaurant business when he was 14 years old. "If we show good direction...we will come up with a genius," added Suniel. "I believe...[the] next Elon Musk and Bill Gates should come from India," stated Suniel.

10.title: Hindutvadis should know Islam rejects terrorism: Owaisi on Al-Qaeda's threat
10.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said "Hindutvadis" should know that Islam rejects terrorism. His statement came after Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) threatened to carry out suicide attacks in Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat. "The name of our Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) is exalted and does not need terrorists like Al-Qaeda to defend it," Owaisi tweeted.

11.title: 1 dead, 18 injured after building collapses in Mumbai's Shastri Nagar
11.article_body: One person died while 18 others were injured after a two-storey residential building collapsed in Mumbai's Shastri Nagar, ANI reported. One of the injured persons is undergoing treatment, while others have been discharged, it added. The incident occurred at around 12:15 am on Thursday, said Manjunath Singe, DCP Mumbai Police. "All of them are labourers from Bihar," he added.

12.title: Domestic violence doesn't have a gender: Johnny Depp's lawyer on criticism of verdict
12.article_body: On being asked about victims' advocate groups claiming that Johnny Depp's defamation trial victory against his ex-wife Amber Heard is a "blow" to the #MeToo movement, Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez said, "We encourage any victim to come forward." She added, "Domestic violence doesn't have a gender." "The verdict speaks for itself, the facts are what they are," she further stated.

13.title: Delhi Police file FIR against Nupur Sharma, Naveen Jindal, Saba Naqvi for spreading hate
13.article_body: Delhi Police have registered an FIR against Naveen Kumar Jindal, the expelled head of Delhi BJP's media unit, journalist Saba Naqvi and others for allegedly spreading messages of hate and inciting various groups, according to DCP (IFSO) KPS Malhotra. A second FIR was registered under similar sections against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and other social media users, police said.

14.title: This was never about money: Depp's lawyer on if he'll forego $10mn payout from Heard
14.article_body: On being asked if Johnny Depp will forego the over $10 million payout from Amber Heard, his lawyer said, "This was never about money for Depp. This was about restoring his reputation, and he's done that." Depp had sued Heard, claiming she defamed him when she published a Washington Post op-ed where she described herself as victim of domestic violence.

15.title: 6 Thai policemen get life sentences for torturing man to death
15.article_body: Six policemen were sentenced to life imprisonment for torturing a 24-year-old drug suspect to death during interrogation in Thailand. The officers were arrested after a video of the interrogation went viral last year. The video showed the suspect's head wrapped with seven plastic bags while being questioned. The officers also tried to extort $60,000 from the man.

16.title: As an actor, I'm getting my due after 20 years: Panchayat actor Faisal
16.article_body: 'Panchayat' actor Faisal Malik said he is getting his due after 20 years as an actor, adding his phone hasn't stopped ringing since 'Panchayat' started streaming. "This time, the pressure was huge...I used to sit alone for hours for four-five days," added Faisal. "Earlier I struggled due to not having work, now there is fear with projects available," stated Faisal.

17.title: Pune metro station features in Jawan teaser, official says 'open to offers'
17.article_body: Pune Metro Rail on Wednesday announced on Twitter that its Sant Tukaram Nagar metro station has featured in actor Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan'. "No other filmmakers, after the shooting of Shah Rukh Khan's movie, have approached Maha Metro for film shooting purposes but we are open for such offers in future," a Maha Metro official said.

18.title: About 20,000 meritorious students in Himachal to get laptops
18.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur on Wednesday launched a laptop distribution programme under the Srinivasa Ramanujan Student Digital Scheme to provide free laptops to about 20,000 meritorious students in the state. The government has spent ₹83 crore on the initiative. The CM said this move would motivate other students to excel in academics and win a laptop.

19.title: SP MLC booked for remarks against Lord Shiva, Shivling in UP
19.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader and UP MLC Lal Bihari Yadav has been booked for allegedly making offensive remarks against Lord Shiva and Shivling. The action was taken by police based on a complaint from Bajrang Dal workers, who alleged that Yadav's comments hurt religious sentiments. This comes after claims of a Shivling being found in Gyanvapi Mosque premises were made.

20.title: India reports 7,240 new COVID-19 cases, nearly 40% jump for 2nd straight day
20.article_body: India has reported 7,240 COVID-19 cases, 3,591 recoveries, and 8 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 5,233 COVID-19 cases and 7 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 32,498, while the death toll reached 5,24,723.

21.title: Switch over to e-offices completely by June 30: Delhi govt to all depts
21.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal-led Delhi government has asked all its departments to switch over to e-offices completely by June 30. All departments have been asked to put the requisite infrastructure in place by June 20, as per the official statement. The departments have also been directed to set up a central record unit, equipped with high-speed scanners, computers and internet connectivity.

22.title: Delhi Metro services delayed on Blue Line, 3rd incident in past 4 days
22.article_body: Train services on Delhi Metro's Blue Line, running between Dwarka Sector-21 and Vaishali and Noida Electronic City, were delayed on Thursday morning, the DMRC said. According to DMRC, an over-head electrification wire has been damaged, which is causing the delay. Notably, this is the third incident in past four days when Blue Line services have been affected.

23.title: Missed opportunity to learn from Aamir Khan during Sarfarosh: Sonali
23.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre recalled working with Aamir Khan in 'Sarfarosh' and stated that she "enjoyed it". "I missed the opportunity to consciously learn from Aamir during 'Sarfarosh'," she added. The film also featured Naseeruddin Shah and was directed by John Matthew Matthan. Sonali, talking about OTT platforms, said, "If OTT platforms wouldn't have come, we wouldn't have got second innings."

24.title: Working with Abhishek should happen; priority is still family, child: Aishwarya
24.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai, while speaking about working with husband and actor Abhishek Bachchan again, said, "It should happen." She also said that her family and her daughter, Aaradhya, continue to remain her priority. "I braved and stepped out to complete Mani sir's 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', but that doesn't change my focus for my family and Aaradhya," she added.

25.title: Karnataka reports 376 new COVID-19 cases; 358 in Bengaluru alone
25.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday reported 376 new COVID-19 cases, out of which 358 were reported in Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 222 recoveries the same day, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) data showed. With the new infections, the active COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru have risen to 2,526. The positivity rate in the city now stands at 2.01%.

26.title: Applications for Scaler’s Data Science Program soar by 200%: Scaler
26.article_body: Scaler shares that since they have opened doors to non-coders for its Data Science program, demand has doubled with more than 30,000 applications received in May alone. The program comes with two specializations depending on the learner's background. Non-coders can upskill with Analytics while experienced professionals can deep dive into coding with Machine Learning specialization, stated Scaler.

27.title: We need US General to call out Chinese activities near Ladakh: Owaisi
27.article_body: After a US General called Chinese build-up near Ladakh alarming, AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said it should shame the government that a foreigner has to say it. "We need US General to tell us that the situation in Ladakh from the Chinese preparations and activities is 'alarming' and 'eye-opening' because our vocal PM has forgotten how to pronounce China," he tweeted.

28.title: Hyd gang-rape case accused Saduddin Malik sent to 3-day police custody
28.article_body: A Nampally court in Telangana sent Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case accused Saduddin Malik to three-day police custody till June 11. Notably, Malik is the only major among the six accused who have been arrested. A 17-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped when she was returning home after a party in the Jubilee Hills area on May 28.

29.title: Which are the world's 20 best universities as per latest rankings?
29.article_body: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) was ranked the world's best university for the 11th year in a row in the latest rankings by global higher education analysts Quacquarelli Symonds (QS). Apart from MIT, eight other US universities made it to the top 20. UK's University of Cambridge was ranked second. Switzerland's ETH Zurich was ranked ninth.

30.title: Iran raises concern over Prophet remark with India, NSA Ajit Doval assures action
30.article_body: Iran's Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian, who's on a visit to India, raised the controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad by two former BJP leaders with NSA Ajit Doval. Doval noted that the people involved "will be dealt with at the level of the government and related agencies in a way that is a lesson to others", according to Iran's Foreign Ministry.

31.title: No country except India is providing money for fuel: Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
31.article_body: Urging IMF to "expedite" its assistance programme to Sri Lanka, the country's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that no country except India is providing money for fuel amid the economic crisis. Stating that India cannot go on providing aid to Sri Lanka, Wickremesinghe further said, "Our Indian credit line is now nearing its end. We are talking about extending it."

32.title: Which are the top Indian institutes in latest world university rankings?
32.article_body: Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru emerged as the topmost Indian institute, ranking at the 155th spot, in the QS World University Rankings 2023.It is followed by IIT Bombay (172), IIT Delhi (174), IIT Madras (250), IIT Kanpur (264), IIT Kharagpur (270), IIT Roorkee (369), IIT Guwahati (384) and IIT Indore (396). Delhi University comes next on the list.

33.title: Fire breaks out at building in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar market, 80 rescued
33.article_body: A fire broke out in the basement of a commercial building in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar market on Wednesday, officials said. At least 80 people were rescued safely by fire personnel from three floors. Notably, the building houses a private bank on the ground and first floors, and a private company on the second and third floors.

34.title: Fire breaks out in evidence room of police station in Delhi, probe on
34.article_body: A fire broke out in 'malkhana' or evidence room of Delhi's Mandawali police station on Wednesday night. Reports said 10 fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the fire was brought under control late at night. No casualties were reported in the incident. Police said that some property was damaged in the fire and a probe has been initiated.

35.title: Famous Afghan model arrested by Taliban for disrespecting Islam; video surfaces
35.article_body: The Taliban have arrested a famous Afghan fashion model and three of his colleagues, accusing them of disrespecting Islam and the Quran. Ajmal Haqiqi appeared handcuffed in videos posted on Twitter by the Taliban intelligence agency on Tuesday. In a viral video, Haqiqi was seen laughing as his colleague Ghulam Sakhi recited verses of Quran in a comical voice.

36.title: Couldn't go to Switzerland for 'Dilwale..', SRK, Aditya still remind me: Farah
36.article_body: Choreographer Farah Khan said after late choreographer Saroj Khan refused to work on songs of 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', filmmaker Aditya Chopra and actor Shah Rukh Khan asked her to fly to Switzerland immediately. She said she could not go due to another ongoing project. Farah added that Chopra and Khan remind her of her refusal even today.

37.title: Haven't forgotten: Maha CM on renaming Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar
37.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said that he has not forgotten his late father Balasaheb Thackeray's promise of renaming Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar and said, "We will change it." "Hindutva is in our every breath," Uddhav Thackeray added. Criticising BJP in a rally in Aurangabad, he said, "If you have the courage then go and recite Hanuman Chalisa in Kashmir."

38.title: They work to spread violence: RSS leader on Al-Qaeda's threat
38.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar said organisations like terror outfit Al-Qaeda "work to spread violence", after Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) threatened to carry out suicide attacks in Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat. He said, "Such an attitude is anti-Khuda, anti-Islam, anti-Muhammad and anti-humanity." The threat came after ex-BJP leaders' remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

39.title: 3 killed, 7 injured as shop collapses in Rajasthan's Udaipur
39.article_body: Police said three labourers were killed and seven others were injured after a shop collapsed when digging work was underway near an under-construction shop in Rajasthan's Udaipur district. Police added that the adjoining shop collapsed, leaving three labourers identified as Nilesh Menaria, Bhavesh Tamboli and Jaspal Singh dead. The injured are being treated, the police added.

40.title: Arhaan was in shock after my accident, he didn't believe anyone: Malaika
40.article_body: Malaika Arora recalled how her son Arhaan was in a "shock" after he came to know about her car accident. "He had no clue of the extent of damage that I'd suffered. He only wanted to be sure that I was fine," she added. "Although he was told everything about my surgery and recovery, he didn't believe anyone," she said.

41.title: Working with Farhan was amazing, he's fascinating: Ms Marvel actress Iman
41.article_body: Speaking about working with Farhan Akhtar in Ms Marvel, actress Iman Vellani said,  "My experience working with Farhan was amazing...On set, we'd have quiet moments and he'd just be telling me stories about going sky-diving, what it's like filming...movies." "I find him...a fascinating person...It's crazy that I grew up watching him and now I'm working with him," she added.

42.title: PM needs to step in if he wants to stop this poison: Naseeruddin on Prophet remark
42.article_body: Naseeruddin Shah expressed his resentment over derogatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. "I wish...the hatemongers whom...PM seems to follow on Twitter, he does something to silence them," the actor told NDTV. "I think this is the time when he needs to step in if he really wants to stop this poison from spreading," he added.

43.title: Taapsee Pannu lists Mithali Raj's achievements, says 'You changed the game'
43.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, who is portraying Mithali Raj in upcoming film 'Shabaash Mithu', took to social media to pen a note following the cricketer's retirement from international cricket. "Some personalities and their achievements are gender agnostic...You changed the game, now it's our turn to change the perspective!" she wrote, listing Mithali's achievements.

44.title: Govt issues high-severity warnings for Google Chrome & Mozilla Firefox users
44.article_body: The government's Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) recently flagged vulnerabilities in Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox products. Chrome versions prior to 96.0.4664.209 are affected with vulnerabilities which could be exploited by attackers, CERT-In said. Vulnerabilities in Firefox could allow attackers to disclose sensitive information, bypass security restrictions etc, it said.

45.title: I-T Dept mistakenly reduces TDS on virtual digital assets to 0.1%, corrects it to 1%
45.article_body: Income Tax Department portal on Wednesday updated its document on tax deducted at source (TDS), reiterating that TDS on payments made on the transfer of virtual digital assets remains at 1%, as stated in Budget. The website earlier mentioned that it has been dropped to 0.1%. However, after the change was noticed, the website updated the document rectifying the error.

46.title: Entire country stands with Kashmiri Pandits: Arvind Kejriwal
46.article_body: Greeting Kashmiri Pandits on 'Jyeshtha Ashtami', Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "I want to assure the Kashmiri Pandit community that the entire country is standing shoulder to shoulder with you in your...happiness and sorrow." His tweet comes amid the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir. "May the blessings of Maa Kheer Bhavani always be with you all," Kejriwal tweeted.

47.title: Latest rankings for Test batters and bowlers released
47.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test batters and bowlers. England's Joe Root jumped to the second spot in batters' rankings, while New Zealand captain Kane Williamson dropped to the fifth spot. Meanwhile, New Zealand pacer Kyle Jamieson jumped to the third position in the bowlers' rankings. England pacer James Anderson jumped two spots to be ranked seventh.

48.title: Future belongs to the BJP: JP Nadda in Kolkata
48.article_body: Addressing the state executive committee meeting in Kolkata, BJP National President JP Nadda said the "future belongs to the BJP" and that his party will defeat TMC in the next elections. Criticising West Bengal's ruling party, he said, "The TMC has no principles or policies, it has only syndicates." He added, "In politics, there is nothing static, things change."

49.title: 2 independent MLAs join BJP in Himachal Pradesh
49.article_body: Two independent MLAs in Himachal Pradesh, Hoshiyar Singh and Prakash Rana, joined BJP on Wednesday in the presence of Chief Minister Jairam Thakur and state BJP President Suresh Kashyap. The independent legislators' joining would make the party and the government stronger, CM Thakur said. Both Singh and Rana had been supporting BJP in the Assembly for long, Suresh Kashyap said.

50.title: Rare 'Indian lipstick plant' spotted in Arunachal after over 100 years
50.article_body: A rare plant, sometimes called the 'Indian lipstick plant', has been rediscovered in the Anjaw district of Arunachal Pradesh after over 100 years, the Botanical Survey of India (BSI) researchers said. Aeschynanthus monetaria Dunn plant was last spotted in 1912 when English botanist Isaac Henry Burkill collected its samples. BSI scientist Krishna Chowlu found it again in December 2021.

51.title: Video shows Bengal CM dancing with tribals at mass wedding ceremony
51.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee danced with a group of tribal women during a mass wedding ceremony in North Bengal's Alipurduar. A video shows the Chief Minister blessing the newly-married couples. "Being part of the magnificent ceremony, she wholeheartedly celebrated and expressed her desire to see our Adivasi brothers and sisters achieve great heights of success," TMC tweeted.

52.title: Break ties with India: Imran Khan to Pak govt on Prophet remark row
52.article_body: Ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan on Tuesday asked the country's government to sever ties with India and boycott Indian products in response to ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Khan alleged that India had been allowed to get away with its "Islamophobic policies" so far. Countries including Qatar and Kuwait had summoned Indian envoys over the remarks.

53.title: Proud of my guy: Shibani on Farhan's 1st look from his H'wood debut Ms Marvel
53.article_body: Actress Shibani Dandekar said that she is extremely proud of her husband, actor Farhan Akhtar, who made his Hollywood debut with 'Ms Marvel'. Taking to Instagram Stories, Shibani expressed her excitement about Farhan's role in the show and wrote, "Can't wait for this. So proud of my guy."

54.title: Delhi logs 564 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs; 114 more than Tuesday
54.article_body: Delhi reported 564 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, an increase of 114 cases as compared to Tuesday's tally. The national capital reported one death and the positivity rate surged to 2.84% as compared to the previous day's tally of 1.92%. The overall case count in Delhi stands at 19,09,991, while there are 1,691 active cases.

55.title: UN's plan to restart Ukraine grain exports is reasonable: Türkiye
55.article_body: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu on Wednesday said that UN's plan to restart grain exports from Ukraine along a sea corridor was "reasonable". "We're ready to guarantee the safety of vessels leaving Ukrainian ports and heading for (Turkish waters)," Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said. Ukrainian grain supplies are stuck for export as Russia has blockaded Ukraine's Black Sea ports.

56.title: What records does Mithali Raj hold in international cricket?
56.article_body: Mithali Raj, who retired from international cricket, is the highest run-scorer in women's international cricket (10,868 runs). She's the highest run-scorer in women's ODIs with 7,805 runs. She has scored the most fifty-plus scores (71) in women's ODIs. She also holds the record for being the youngest batter (16 years and 205 days) to slam a century in women's ODIs.

57.title: FIR filed after 5-yr-old Delhi girl left under sun for not doing homework
57.article_body: After a video showed a five-year-old girl being tied up and left on the roof of a house for not doing homework, the police have registered an FIR under the Juvenile Justice Act. The case has been registered at the Khajuri Khas Police Station. Further investigation is underway in connection with the case.

58.title: CISF writes to MHA to review Lok Sabha MP Navneet Rana's security
58.article_body: The CISF has written to the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) to review the security of Lok Sabha MP Navneet Rana. Navneet was accorded 'Y' category security cover in April. Navneet and her husband were granted bail in May after being arrested in a sedition case over threats to chant Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence in Mumbai.

59.title: Kamal Haasan gifts his Rolex watch worth ₹47 lakh to Suriya, actor shares pics
59.article_body: Following the success of 'Vikram', actor Kamal Haasan on Wednesday gifted actor Suriya, who played the role of Rolex in the film, his own Rolex watch worth ₹47 lakh. Sharing pictures on social media, Suriya wrote, ''A moment like this makes life beautiful! Thank you Anna for your #Rolex!" 'Vikram' is Kamal Haasan's third film to cross ₹100-crore earnings worldwide.

60.title: Great efforts: China on India helping Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
60.article_body: The Indian government has made "great efforts" to help Sri Lanka during its worst economic crisis, China said on Wednesday. China recognises India's efforts, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said. "We also are willing to work with India and other members of the international community to help Sri Lanka and other countries with difficulties," he added.

61.title: Don't sell country for few pieces of gold: BJP to Kerala govt
61.article_body: BJP criticised the CPI(M)-led LDF government in Kerala on Wednesday over a case of alleged gold smuggling and asked it to not sell the country for a few pieces of gold. "The Kerala Chief Minister should look into his conscience after these charges and step down from his post," BJP spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said.

62.title: Contract of coach who allegedly asked Indian woman cyclist to sleep with him terminated
62.article_body: Sports Authority of India (SAI) terminated the contract of cycling coach RK Sharma following allegations of inappropriate behaviour against him by a top Indian woman cyclist. It noted that "prima facie, the case is established and the allegations...are found to be true". The cyclist alleged Sharma forced himself into her room in Slovenia and asked her to sleep with him.

63.title: Issuing threats not Indian culture: Uma Bharti on Prophet remark row
63.article_body: BJP leader Uma Bharti condemned threats being issued to suspended party spokesperson Nupur Sharma over latter's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "Our party gave punishment to [her] and MEA handled [the] situation on [the] reaction of Muslim nations well but threats to Nupur Sharma is not Indian culture," Bharti said. Sharma was suspended from the party on June 5.

64.title: BJP govt's 'conspiracy' behind Nupur Sharma's remarks: Cong leader
64.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao alleged that a "conspiracy" by BJP-led Centre is behind the controversial remarks of former party spokesperson Nupur Sharma. "With their controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, a lot of damage was caused to our country at the international level," Rao said. "BJP leaders like Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal should be arrested immediately," he added.

65.title: No need for anti-conversion law in Bihar: CM Nitish Kumar
65.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has said that there is "no need" for an anti-conversion law in the state. "The government has always been alert here. And all people, be they from any religious group, live in peace," Nitish Kumar said. Union minister Giriraj Singh had earlier said that there is a need for an anti-conversion law in the state.

66.title: That's wrong, I was kicked out of college: Mrunal on having 2 college degrees
66.article_body: Mrunal Thakur, who made her acting debut with a television show in 2012, while she was in college, said the reports that she has two degrees are false. "That's wrong. Whoever has written that...[on] Wikipedia, I'm...thankful," she added. "I don't have any degree. I was kicked out of college. I was detained from [college]...because I had attendance problems," Mrunal said.

67.title: Fintech market likely to reach $150 bn valuation by 2025: MoS Finance
67.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Wednesday said the growth in Indian fintech startups has been exponential and the market is expected to reach a valuation of $150 billion by 2025. India's fintech adoption rate is at 87% as against the global average of 64%, Chaudhary noted. Fintech is one of India's immensely growing sectors, he added.

68.title: Northeast marching ahead to be at par with rest of India: Minister
68.article_body: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal on Wednesday said that the Northeast is marching ahead to be at par with the rest of India. "Congress never gave importance to Northeast in the last 60 years due to which the region remained neglected despite its huge potential," he said. Had to face several challenges in the development of the region, he added.

69.title: UN collaborates with Uber to deliver aid in Ukraine amid war
69.article_body: The UN's World Food Programme (WFP) has teamed up with Uber to supply aid to people in war-torn Ukraine. Uber's customised 'Uber Direct' software app will help coordinate, dispatch and track a fleet of smaller vehicles in areas where large vehicles may not be able to reach. WFP aims to provide aid to three million people per month by June.

70.title: Only India providing money for fuel: Lankan PM amid forex crisis
70.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Wednesday urged the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to "expedite" its assistance programme to Sri Lanka and said India is the only country providing money for fuel to the crisis-hit nation. Sri Lanka has already begun restructuring its foreign debts, a prerequisite for an IMF programme. The country suspended external debt payments on April 12.

71.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature today released
71.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that recorded maximum temperature of 44°C and above on Wednesday. Rajasthan's Ganganagar and Vidarbha's Bramhapuri recorded highest maximum temperature at 46.2°C, followed by 45.7°C in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehgarh. Chhattisgarh's Durg and Vidarbha's Gondia recorded maximum temperature of 45.6°C, while several places also recorded maximum temperature of 45.2°C.

72.title: Baseless: KT Jaleel on allegations made in gold smuggling case
72.article_body: Ex-Kerala Minister KT Jaleel on Wednesday filed a police complaint against allegations levelled by Kerala gold smuggling case prime accused Swapna Suresh, calling the allegations "baseless". Jaleel said the allegations are part of a controversy hatched by Suresh, ex-Congress MLA PC George and BJP. Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan also dismissed Suresh's allegations against him and his family.

73.title: Still don't know why my son was killed: Sidhu Moosewala's father
73.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's father on Wednesday said he still does not understand why his son was killed and stated that the family will not rest till he gets justice. "We have given time to the government," he said, referring to the action to be taken against the perpetrators. "Until we get justice, we will not rest," he added.

74.title: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi masterminded Sidhu Moosewala's killing: Delhi Police
74.article_body: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi is the mastermind behind the killing of singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, Delhi Police said on Wednesday. Bishnoi had earlier denied a role in Moosewala's killing while admitting he was killed for revenge. At least five people were involved in the killing, Delhi Police Special CP HGS Dhaliwal said.

75.title: People will see me in action comedy avatar: Kartik Aaryan on Shehzada
75.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'Shehzada', actor Kartik Aaryan said that it is one of those films that has a very wide appeal among the audiences. "I am really excited and looking forward to the film," he added. "People will get to see me in this complete avatar of action and comedy for the first time," Kartik said.

76.title: Musk shares meme targeting YouTube over 'scam ads', Twitter users say 'Buy YouTube'
76.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "YouTube seems to be nonstop scam ads." He also shared a meme on YouTube's policy against people swearing as opposed to when there are "obvious scam ads all over their site". "Please buy YouTube," a Twitter user reacted. "Once you learn...about their free speech policies, you...may try to buy them too," another comment read.

77.title: Azadi March will continue even if Pak govt puts us in jail: Khan
77.article_body: Ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan on Tuesday challenged the government to stop him from leading Azadi March movement. He added that Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf's (PTI) movement against the government will continue even if the administration puts PTI workers in jail or resorts to other measures. Khan was granted pre-arrest bail till June 25 after being accused of inciting violence at the rally.

78.title: Sought red corner notice against Brar 10 days before Moosewala's death: Punjab Police
78.article_body: The Punjab Police on Wednesday said it had sought a red corner notice against Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar on May 19, 10 days before Sidhu Moosewala's murder. Brar has claimed responsibility for Moosewala's murder on behalf of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. The red corner notice was sought in two separate cases registered against Brar in Faridkot.

79.title: 5-yr-old girl tied up, left on hot roof for not doing homework in Delhi; video surfaces
79.article_body: A video of a five-year-old girl tied up and left on the roof of a house as punishment in Delhi has been widely shared online, leading to an inquiry by the police. The girl was left in the scorching heat for not doing her homework, officials said. The video showed the child screaming and writhing on the roof.

80.title: Didn't want to do Pyaar Ka Punchnama, Rajkummar said, 'Are you mad?': Nushrratt
80.article_body: Nushrratt Bharuccha said after the success of her film 'Love Sex Aur Dhokha' (LSD), she wanted to do films in that genre and had refused to do 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'. "But then I had good co-stars in LSD, Raj (Rajkummar Rao) and Amit (Sial) who said, 'Are you mad? You're being offered a film. It's a big deal'," she added.

81.title: Mumbai sees 1,765 new COVID cases, highest since Jan 25; positivity rate at 9.19%
81.article_body: Mumbai reported 1,765 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, which is the highest since January 25. The city reported a 42% increase in fresh cases in a single day as it reported 1,242 cases on Tuesday. The COVID-19 positivity rate in the city has risen to 9.19%, while zero deaths were reported in the last 24 hours.

82.title: K'taka man kills 17-yr-old daughter over relationship with Dalit boy
82.article_body: A man allegedly strangled his 17-year-old daughter to death for having a relationship with a Dalit boy and surrendered before the police in the Mysuru district of Karnataka on Tuesday. Despite being asked not to, the deceased contacted the boy on Monday, which led to an altercation with her father, following which he strangled her to death, police said.

83.title: Shilpa gifts herself vanity van with yoga deck on her 47th b'day; pics surface
83.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty reportedly gifted herself a new vanity van with a kitchenette, hair wash station, and a yoga deck on her 47th birthday. According to reports, she wanted to ensure that even when she's shooting, she can practice yoga within the comforts of her own vanity van. Several pictures of the vanity van have also surfaced online.

84.title: Chennithala demands Kerala CM's ouster amid gold smuggling scam
84.article_body: Kerala Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala on Wednesday reacted to the allegations levelled against CM Pinarayi Vijayan by Swapna Suresh, the prime accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case, stating the claims made are "unprecedented and shocking". Chennithala also demanded Vijayan's resignation. Suresh has claimed that CM Vijayan, his wife and his daughter were involved in the scam.

85.title: Fringe is BJP's core: Rahul Gandhi amid row over remarks on Prophet
85.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said "fringe" is the BJP's core and highlighted some derogatory statements made by BJP leaders in the past. The post included comments by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who allegedly called Bangladeshi migrants "termites" and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who said that women "are not capable of being left free or independent".

86.title: Shutdown in J&K over social media posts backing BJP's Nupur Sharma
86.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar town observed a shutdown demanding the arrest of three Bharatiya Janata Party and IkkJutt Jammu leaders for their alleged social media posts extending support to BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. The three leaders, according to the protesters, include Ashish Sharma, the BJP's Youth Wing general secretary in J&K and IkkJutt leaders Sparsh Parihar and Anshuman Rathore.

87.title: Pause, take a look: Editors' body to news channels over Kanpur violence
87.article_body: Editors Guild of India on Wednesday said it's disturbed by "irresponsible" conduct of some national news channels after violence broke out in Kanpur. "The EGI demands that these channels pause and take a critical look at what they have done by giving legitimacy to divisive and toxic voices," it said. EGI called for stricter vigilance by broadcasters and journalist bodies.

88.title: Don't fall prey to fraudulent texts on bill payments: BESCOM
88.article_body: Amid Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) consumers getting fraudulent texts of discontinuation of electricity due to non-payment of bills, the company has told its consumers that these texts are fake. BESCOM clarified that it does not insist on payment through text messages. "We have taken cognisance of such fraudulent acts by reporting...to cybercrime police," officials said.

89.title: Orangutan attacks man by pulling his T-shirt & grabbing his leg in Indonesia zoo
89.article_body: A viral video has captured an orangutan attacking a man through its cage. The video, filmed at an Indonesian zoo, shows the ape dragging him closer by first grabbing his T-shirt and then holding one of his legs and refusing to let go. The visitor reportedly broke rules by climbing over the fence separating the orangutan enclosure from zoo visitors.

90.title: Unscientific: India on getting lowest rank on global environment performance index
90.article_body: India has rejected the analysis of the 2022 Environmental Performance Index, which ranked it lowest among 180 countries. "Some of these indicators used for assessing performance are extrapolated and based on...unscientific methods," said the Environment Ministry. Many indicators of the index, devised by Yale and Columbia University researchers, are based on "unfounded assumptions", it said.

91.title: KL Rahul, Kuldeep Yadav ruled out of T20I series against SA; Rishabh Pant named captain
91.article_body: KL Rahul and Kuldeep Yadav have been ruled out of India's T20I series against South Africa owing to injury. The BCCI have named wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant as captain of the side in place of Rahul. Meanwhile, all-rounder Hardik Pandya has been appointed vice-captain for the series. The five-match series will begin on Thursday.

92.title: Latvian national held with cocaine worth ₹69 cr at Mumbai airport
92.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence arrested a 24-year-old Latvian national for alleged possession of 6.9 kg of cocaine worth ₹69 crore at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, an official said on Wednesday. A DRI official said that the accused was traveling from Brazil and had concealed the contraband material in plastic pouches in a trolley bag.

93.title: 5 injured in blast triggered to dig up a well on riverbed in Pune
93.article_body: At least five people were injured in a blast triggered to dig up a well on the Mula Mutha riverbed in Pune's Kharadi area. Tin roofs of six houses were damaged due to the explosion. None of the injured persons required hospitalisation, police said, adding that one of the persons who triggered the blast had been arrested.

94.title: Cannot cancel liquor vend licence over public sentiment: Delhi HC
94.article_body: Delhi High Court has ruled that a licence issued under the Delhi Excise Act, 2009 cannot be cancelled merely because "public sentiment" is against a liquor vend's location. It said licences can only be cancelled if they fall foul of statutory provisions or violate rules. Public opinion isn't relevant under the Act for locating a liquor vend, the HC added.

95.title: Harmanpreet Kaur appointed India Women ODI captain after Mithali Raj's retirement
95.article_body: After Mithali Raj announced her retirement from international cricket, Harmanpreet Kaur was appointed the captain of the India Women ODI team. The BCCI announced India Women squad for the upcoming tour of Sri Lanka, naming Harmanpreet as captain and Smriti Mandhana as vice-captain. Mithali retired from international cricket after a 23-year-long career.

96.title: Was like 'It's too much': Neena on being offered lot of money for a project
96.article_body: When asked if she's paid well for her work now after facing financial issues for many years, Neena Gupta said, "I've been offered...good money...I...asked my manager how much money I'm getting and I was told this much." "I was like 'nahi yaar, ye...bahut jyada hain, itne kyu maange (no, it's too much, why did you ask for it)'," she added.

97.title: Debt got costlier amid inflation: Congress on RBI's repo rate hike
97.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala reacted to RBI's repo rate hike stating that the move will negatively impact people. "Today, the repo rate has increased...by 0.50%...People tied with debts will now be forced to deal with increased EMIs. Debt became costlier along with inflation, unemployment and empty pockets," Surjewala said. RBI raised the repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%.

98.title: Delhi court upholds order discharging Delhi CM, Dy CM in assault case
98.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday upheld a trial court's order giving clean chit to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia in a case of alleged assault on former chief secretary Anshu Prakash. Prakash had alleged that he was called for a meeting at Kejriwal's residence in 2018 and was assaulted by AAP MLAs.

99.title: He was under threat; used to travel with bodyguards: Jose Covaco on Raghu
99.article_body: Jose Covaco, who worked closely with Raghu Ram on MTV's Roadies, recalled how Raghu took the show to another level. In an appearance on The Ranveer Show podcast, Jose said the show was so popular that judges had to be barricaded and would always travel with bodyguards. He added because Raghu had a controversial image, he was constantly under threat.

100.title: Italy arrests 14 Pakistanis linked to 2020 Charlie Hebdo attack
100.article_body: Italy's anti-terrorism police and Europol on Tuesday arrested 14 Pakistanis in Genoa during an anti-terror raid, reports stated. The arrested persons have been accused of having links with Zaheer Hassan Mahmoud, the alleged conspirator of the 2020 Charlie Hebdo attack in Paris. Mahmoud had allegedly attacked two people after Charlie Hebdo republished controversial cartoons of Prophet Muhammad.

101.title: Alarming, eye-opening: US General on Chinese activity near Ladakh
101.article_body: American General Charles A Flynn on Wednesday commented on the buildup of Chinese infrastructure near Ladakh. Flynn, who's on a four-day India visit, said, "The [Chinese] activity level is eye-opening. Some of the infrastructure being created in the PLA's Western Theatre Command is alarming." He said the Chinese must be questioned about their intentions with regard to the infrastructre.

102.title: Iran removes 2 UN watchdog surveillance cameras from nuclear facility
102.article_body: Iran has removed two surveillance cameras of the UN nuclear watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) from one of its nuclear facilities, state media reported. "Iran cannot be cooperative while...IAEA displays unreasonable behaviour. We hope the agency will come to its senses and respond with cooperation with Iran," Iran's Atomic Energy Organisation spokesman Behrouz Kamalvandi said.

103.title: Hyd teen loses ₹36 lakh received after father's death in gambling
103.article_body: A teenage boy in Hyderabad gambled away ₹36 lakh received as ex-gratia after his father's death. His father was a police officer who had died on duty, after which the ex-gratia amount was deposited into the deceased's wife's account. The police informed the woman that her son was using a mobile gaming platform to place bets with the money.

104.title: 'Hidden world' of marine life discovered under Antarctic ice, pics released
104.article_body: A 'hidden world' of aquatic life has been discovered 500 metres below the ice in Antarctica with shrimp-like creatures in a vast cathedral-like cavern. Scientists from New Zealand found the ecosystem under the Ross ice shelf as they were investigating impact of global warming in a suspected estuary. They captured the organisms after lowering a camera through a drill hole.

105.title: Grant me bail as CBI chargesheet is incomplete: Anil Deshmukh to court
105.article_body: Ex-Maharashtra Minister Anil Deshmukh on Wednesday approached the Mumbai special court for default bail, claiming that the CBI chargesheet filed against him was incomplete. Deshmukh sought bail under Criminal Procedure Code's Section 167(2) which allows the accused to file for bail if chargesheet is not filed within 60-90 days. CBI filed chargesheet without completing investigation, Deshmukh said.

106.title: Rajasthan minister Meghwal gets threat call demanding ₹70 lakh, FIR filed
106.article_body: Rajasthan minister Govind Ram Meghwal on Wednesday said he has received a threat call from a man, who identified himself as a member of the SOPU gang and demanded ₹70 lakh from him. An FIR has been registered in this case, police said. Meghwal is staying at a resort in Udaipur with other Congress MLAs ahead of Rajya Sabha polls.

107.title: Navi Mumbai to add 75 new AC buses to its fleet soon
107.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT), the civic transport wing, will add 75 more air-conditioned buses to its fleet soon. According to an NMMT official, a tender for 25 buses has been floated and 10 buses will be double-decker buses. The remaining tenders will be finalised by the end of the month, officials said.

108.title: 2 Thane history-sheeters arrested, ₹4.35 lakh stolen items seized
108.article_body: The Kopar Khairane Police arrested two history-sheeters for chain snatching and recovered stolen items worth ₹4.35 lakh from them. With their arrest, police claimed to have solved at least five cases of chain snatching in its jurisdiction. The accused were earlier arrested for their involvement in similar cases and after getting bail, they committed another crime, the police said.

109.title: Man held with foreign currency worth ₹2.7 cr at Delhi metro station
109.article_body: The Central Industrial Security Force on Tuesday apprehended a man at the Punjabi Bagh West Metro Station with foreign currencies worth around ₹2.7 crore, an official said. The accused was intercepted around 1:20 pm and informed CISF officials that he was carrying the money for exchange purposes. He was handed over to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for further questioning.

110.title: Will respond to destabilising moves in north Syria: Turkey to Russia
110.article_body: During a phone call on Tuesday, Turkish Defence Minister Hulusi Akar told Russian counterpart Sergei Shoigu that Turkey will respond to moves aimed at disrupting stability in northern Syria. Last month, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that Turkey would soon be launching new military offensives into northern Syria against Kurdish YPG militia, which it considers a terrorist organisation.

111.title: Pre-monsoon work completed in old city limits: Pune civic body
111.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has claimed to have completed all the pre-monsoon work within old city limits and cleaned all manholes, stormwater lines, culverts and other spots prone to waterlogging. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar also held a review meeting on Tuesday to assess the work done to curb flooding. Notably, 76 waterlogging-prone spots identified by PMC have been cleared.

112.title: Over 9,000 trees cut in Bengaluru due to metro project: RTI data
112.article_body: The Namma Metro project in Karnataka's Bengaluru has led to the loss of over 9,000 trees in the city, according to details available under RTI Act. The said number of chopped trees is only related to Purple and Green Lines. The RTI also revealed that BMRCL axed 680 more trees between 2008 and 2019 for other projects in Bengaluru.

113.title: Major fire breaks out at plastic godown in Thane, doused within 3 hours
113.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a plastic godown in Thane's Bhiwandi on Wednesday. No one was injured in the incident as no employee was working there when the fire broke out, but about 1,800-2,200 square feet area of the godown was burnt. Three fire engines were sent to the spot and the fire was controlled within three hours.

114.title: Debt Recovery Tribunal can't restrain person from flying abroad: HC
114.article_body: Debt Recovery Tribunal (DRT) does not have the power to restrain a person from travelling abroad, the Bombay High Court ruled on Tuesday. DRT, however, has the power to prevent abuse of its process or secure ends of its justice, the HC added. The bench was hearing a plea by a 34-year-old businessman restrained by the DRT from flying abroad.

115.title: Raj Kundra returns to Twitter months after quitting, wishes Shilpa on b'day
115.article_body: Months after deleting his social media handles, actress Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra returned to Twitter on Wednesday to wish her on her birthday. "Happy Happy birthday my soulmate...Love you eternally...My wish for you is that you continue...Continue to be who you are, to astonish a mean world with your acts of kindness," he wrote.

116.title: We've nothing to hide: Pawan Khera on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul Gandhi
116.article_body: As ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, party leader Pawan Khera said the Congress has nothing to hide. "We're a law-abiding party...So, if they have been summoned, of course, they will go. We have nothing to hide," Khera added. Both the leaders have been summoned by the ED in connection with the National Herald case.

117.title: Video shows Tabu preparing & shooting for Anjulika-Manjulika roles in 'Bhool..'
117.article_body: A video shared by T-Series showed actress Tabu preparing and shooting for her double role of 'Anjulika' and 'Manjulika' in the movie 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. In the video, Tabu can be seen doing horror scenes and flying above ground with help of a harness. In the end, she can be seen wrapping up the shoot by cutting a cake.

118.title: Sundar might get selected ahead of Ashwin: Ravi Shastri on T20 WC
118.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri said all-rounder Washington Sundar might get selected ahead of Ravichandran Ashwin in India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2022, if he is fully fit. "[Sundar] has the ability to bowl in the powerplay, he can also bat down the order and also because of his T20 record," added Shastri.

119.title: Sensex, Nifty fall for fourth straight day as RBI hikes repo rate
119.article_body: Indian stock benchmarks Sensex and Nifty fell for the fourth straight day on Wednesday after RBI raised the repo rate by 50 basis points to 4.90%. While Sensex fell 214.85 points to close at 54,892.49, Nifty fell 60.10 points today to close at 16,356.25. Sensex has fallen 926.28 points while Nifty has fallen 271.25 points in last four trading sessions.

120.title: Over 1,000 surrendered Ukrainian fighters sent to Russia: Report
120.article_body: More than 1,000 Ukrainian fighters who surrendered in Mariupol city have been transferred to Russia for investigation, TASS news agency reported citing a Russian law enforcement source. Kyiv is seeking the handover of all the estimated 2,000 fighters from Mariupol's Azovstal steel plant in a prisoner swap. However, Russian lawmakers have demanded that some soldiers be put on trial.

121.title: 6 employees of liquor contractor cheat owner of ₹6.28 cr in MP, booked
121.article_body: Six employees of a liquor contractor were booked for allegedly cheating the owner of ₹6.28 crore in Indore. According to the police, the complainant said he ran 94 shops in Group B during 2021-22. A few months ago, he learned about the "fraud" in 20 of his shops. He suspected that employees and salesmen were involved in the fraud.

122.title: TN CM Stalin inaugurates 'equality village' in Sivaganga district
122.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday inaugurated the Thanthai Periyar Samathuvapuram (equality village) in the Sivaganga district and handed over the keys to the beneficiaries. Constructed at a cost of ₹3.17 crore, the equality village has about 100 houses. It is built on 12.253 acres of land and has facilities such as playground, ration shop and library.

123.title: Fliers not wearing masks to be treated as unruly, deboarded: DGCA in new norms
123.article_body: Aviation regulator DGCA has issued new COVID-19 norms for airports and flights, making masks mandatory throughout the journey. Mask removal is permitted only during "exceptional circumstances", while those violating the mask mandate may be treated as "unruly passengers" and deboarded before departure, DGCA said. Violators can even be put on the 'no-fly' list, it added.

124.title: Theatre screen catches fire during 'Vikram' screening in Puducherry
124.article_body: The screen of a theatre screening Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram' caught fire in Puducherry on Tuesday evening. No one was injured in the incident, but the screen was completely gutted in the fire. The audience started to panic and rush out of the hall and the screening was immediately stopped, officials said.

125.title: I knew 'Heropanti 2' will not work: 'Heropanti' writer Sanjeev Dutta
125.article_body: Sanjeev Dutta, the writer of Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Heropanti', said he knew the film's sequel 'Heropanti 2' will not work. "I...worked very hard on the original film," added Sanjeev. Talking about the "choti bacchi ho kya" dialogue from 'Heropanti', Sanjeev stated, "It feels good that...[it's] going viral." He said he didn't like the dialogue "hum tumme itne chhed karenge" from 'Dabangg'.

126.title: Kangana falls for viral spoof video of Qatar Airways CEO, calls him 'idiot of a man'
126.article_body: Kangana Ranaut called Qatar Airways CEO Akbar Al Baker an "idiot of a man" after falling for a spoof video. The clip was made in response to a video by Twitter user 'Vashudev' who appealed to Indians to boycott Qatar Airways following Qatar's condemnation of a BJP spokesperson's statements on Prophet Muhammad. She deleted her Instagram Stories after being trolled.

127.title: Legends never die: Richa on video showing Moosewala checking his village kids' alphabets
127.article_body: A video showing late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala checking his village children's alphabets has gone viral. Reacting to it, actress Richa Chadha tweeted, "Legends never die." She added, "Every image from Mansa this morning is breaking my heart into a million pieces. Unshakable sadness." Notably, 'Antim Ardaas' or the last prayer for the singer was held in his village today.

128.title: Ishan Kishan would be the player to watch out for in SA T20Is: Parthiv Patel
128.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said opener Ishan Kishan would be the player to watch out for in the five-match T20I series against South Africa. "If Ishan performs well for the Indian team at the top of the order, he brings a whole new dimension, he is also a left-handed option. I wish that he plays freely," stated Parthiv.

129.title: Does Kejriwal still think Jain is innocent?: Smriti Irani on ED’s seizure
129.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday asked Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal that does he still think Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain is "innocent"? Her statement came after the ED said it has found 133 gold coins and ₹2.85 crore in cash during a raid conducted on the premises of Jain and his aide.

130.title: 2 minors taken into custody for stabbing man over a slap in Delhi
130.article_body: Police on Wednesday said two minor boys were taken into custody for allegedly stabbing a 27-year-old man to death in south Delhi's Central Market. The victim, Manish, had slapped one of the two minors over a month ago. The minor, along with two others minor boys, went to the market where Manish worked and stabbed him to take revenge.

131.title: Hundreds of cockroaches released during hearing at US court
131.article_body: A courthouse in US' New York was closed for fumigation on Tuesday after hundreds of cockroaches were released during a hearing, according to court officials. The bug release was being investigated while the courthouse was closed for the rest of the day. The cockroaches were released from plastic containers brought into the courthouse.

132.title: 1 killed, dozen injured as car rams into crowd in Germany
132.article_body: A car drove into a crowd of people in Berlin on Wednesday, killing at least one person and injuring over a dozen people. It's not yet clear if the act was intentional, police said. The incident happened near the scene of a fatal attack in 2016, where an ISIS sympathiser ploughed a truck through a Christmas market, killing 11 people.

133.title: Spread fake news but I can't think of taking son from mom: Mankirt on Moosewala
133.article_body: Singer Mankirt Aulakh took to Instagram to post a video of late singer Sidhu Moosewala's mother and wrote about his alleged involvement in the death of the singer. "People can show me in bad light and media can spread fake news but God knows I can't think of snatching a son from his mother," Aulakh wrote.

134.title: What if I write similar things about your family: Arjun on sisters facing trolls
134.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said that while he's "thick-skinned" and able to defend himself against trolls, he feels bad when his family members are attacked online because of him. He added that their behaviour "shows their upbringing". He further said what if he went to the building of these faceless trolls and wrote something derogatory about the women in their families?

135.title: 107 students, teachers get stuck after following online map in Austria; airlifted
135.article_body: As many as 99 students and eight teachers from Germany had to be airlifted from a ridge after they got stuck in the Austrian Alps. The group followed directions using an online map which led them to an unmarked and difficult trail. They had undertaken the journey after one of the teachers found a "classic evening walk" on the internet.

136.title: What's Dostarlimab, used in 'historic' cancer trial where all 12 patients were cured?
136.article_body: All 12 rectal cancer patients of a historic drug trial in the US were cured after they completed a six-month treatment with Dostarlimab. The experimental drug includes laboratory-made molecules called monoclonal antibodies which act as substitute antibodies in human bodies. It was approved for medical use in the US and EU in 2021. The patients took it every three weeks.

137.title: Looked at President’s Gold Medal with expression like 'That's it?': Haasan
137.article_body: Talking about winning the President's Gold Medal for his 1960 film 'Kalathur Kannamma', Kamal Haasan said, "If you see the picture, I am looking at the award with an expression like, 'Bas? Itna hi hai? (What? That's it?)'." "I thought...that I would [receive] a big present...like a mechanical gun," added Haasan. Haasan won the award at the age of 6.

138.title: Feel very happy: Nitin Gadkari as NHAI sets Guinness World Record
138.article_body: As the NHAI set a Guinness World Record by constructing a 75 km road in 105 hours and 33 minutes, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said it’s a proud moment for the entire nation. "Feel very happy to congratulate our exceptional team (at) NHAI," Gadkari added. The road was constructed in single lane on NH-53 section between Amravati and Akola .

139.title: S'pore's Web3 DAO Samudai raises $2.5 mn, Coinbase invests too
139.article_body: Singapore-based DAO platform for building and managing communities in the Web3, Samudai, has closed a pre-Seed financing round of $2.5 million. Investors like FTX Ventures, Sino Global Capital, Coinbase Ventures, Former Coinbase CTO Balaji Srinivasan and Polygon Founder Sandeep Nailwal participated in the round. Samudai was founded by Kushagra Agarwal and Navin.

140.title: 3 offer minor drug-laced drink, gang-rape her in bus in Bihar
140.article_body: A minor girl was allegedly gang-raped inside a bus by three persons in Bihar's West Champaran district on Wednesday, police said. The girl, in her statement to the police, alleged that the driver and his accomplice had offered her a cold drink, which contained a pill. She fell unconscious after consuming the drink and the accused raped her, police said.

141.title: KK was supposed to be having dinner with my family: Vardhan Puri
141.article_body: Actor Vardhan Puri, who is the grandson of late actor Amrish Puri, revealed late singer KK was to have dinner with his family. "KK was supposed to be having dinner with our family in the third week of June because my father...is...a big admirer of his work," he stated. "KK...said...he'd come home to meet dad...have dinner with us," he added.

142.title: 3 killed, 1 injured in lightning incidents in Gujarat
142.article_body: At least three people were killed and one was injured in lightning strike incidents in Gujarat's Patan and Surendranagar districts, police said. One of the deceased, a 35-year-old woman, was working on a field in Patan's Roda village and was struck by lightning amid light rainfall. Another deceased was a 25-year-old tribal man from Nani Kathechi village in Surendranagar.

143.title: Not for 1st time: Kerala Minister on gold smuggling claims against CM
143.article_body: Kerala Tourism Minister PA Mohammed Riyas on Wednesday said it wasn't the first time that Swapna Suresh, an accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case, had made allegations against CM Pinarayi Vijayan. "The CM and party Secretary have reacted to this. Our stand is also the same," said Riyas, who is also the son-in-law of the Chief Minister.

144.title: Andhra Pradesh to provide tractors at subsidised rates to farmers
144.article_body: YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led Andhra Pradesh government has decided to provide tractors at subsidised rates to farmers at custom hiring centres across the state. He launched the scheme called 'YSR Yantra Seva' at Chuttugunta village in Guntur where he flagged off 3,800 tractors. Reddy also transferred ₹175 crore into the accounts of 5,260 farmers through direct benefit transfer.

145.title: Ex-Afghan minister returns to Kabul after Taliban's invitation
145.article_body: A former Afghan minister, who fled Afghanistan last year after the Taliban seized power in the country, returned to Kabul on Wednesday following security assurances from the group, officials said. Ghulam Farooq Wardak, who served in the cabinets of former Presidents Hamid Karzai and Ashraf Ghani, reportedly returned from Turkey. "Most authorities are thinking about returning," Wardak said.

146.title: Coin museum inaugurated in Hyd to celebrate Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav
146.article_body: A coin exhibition, showcasing the history of coin-making and collection at the Saifabad Mint in Hyderabad, was inaugurated on Tuesday as part of the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations. It will display 120 years of coinage history and will be open to the public from June 8 till June 13, 2022, from 10 am to 5 pm.

147.title: 'Antim Ardas' for Moosewala held in Mansa, fans gather to pay tributes
147.article_body: The ‘Antim Ardas’ and ‘Bhog’ ceremonies for late singer Sidhu Moosewala were held by his family members at Baahrali Anaj Mandi in Moosa village of Punjab’s Mansa district on Wednesday. A large number of fans assembled to pay their tributes. Moosewala's parents addressed the gathering. He was shot dead in Mansa on May 29.

148.title: Girls dreaming of playing cricket will dream of doing what Mithali did: Bhogle
148.article_body: Reacting to India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj's retirement from all forms of international cricket, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "You have been a jewel in the crown of Indian cricket." "When another little girl like you once were dreams of playing cricket, she will dream of doing what you did," added Bhogle in his tweet. Mithali scored 10,868 international runs.

149.title: To represent India for 23 years is just amazing: Laxman on Mithali's retirement
149.article_body: Reacting to India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj announcing her retirement, ex-India cricketer VVS Laxman tweeted, "To play for India is a dream a very few fulfill, and to be able to represent the nation for 23 years is just amazing." He added, "You have been a pillar to Women's Cricket...and have shaped the lives of many young girls."

150.title: Please tell me about it too: Sonakshi on wedding rumours with Zaheer Iqbal
150.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha took to Instagram to react to her wedding rumours with actor Zaheer Iqbal. Sharing a video, Sonakshi wrote in the subtitles, "Me to the media: Kyu haath dho kar meri shaadi karwana chahte ho?!?" She captioned the video, "If you've already fixed my mehendi, proposal, roka and sangeet, then please tell me about it too."

151.title: 3 'dangerous' men escape from US jail after cutting holes in ceiling
151.article_body: Three 'armed and dangerous' inmates are on the run after escaping from a prison in US' Missouri by cutting holes in the plaster ceiling of their cells and crawling to a maintenance door that led outside. The men escaped on Friday. Two of the men were in jail on drug and weapons charges, while the third was jailed for theft.

152.title: Weddings banned after 10 pm in Pak, 5-day work week adopted amid electricity crisis
152.article_body: Pakistan government has announced a ban on wedding ceremonies in Islamabad after 10 pm to conserve electricity as the country is going through a power crisis. The country has also reduced its official work week to five days from six in a bid to reduce energy and fuel consumption. "We are facing a severe crisis," Information Minister Marriyum Aurangzeb said.

153.title: Ex-Tesla worker given 2 weeks to accept $15 mn payout over racism
153.article_body: A former elevator operator at Tesla has been given two weeks by a US judge to decide whether to accept $15 million in damages over racial abuse at the firm. A jury had awarded him $6.9 million of compensatory damages and $130 million of punitive damages last October. Judge William Orrick reduced both later saying the jury award was excessive.

154.title: Plant a sapling in my son’s memory: Moosewala's mother at prayer meeting
154.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's mother Charan Kaur urged his fans to plant a sapling in her son's memory in an emotional appeal to the people who gathered in Punjab's Mansa district for the Antim Ardaas or the prayer meeting on Wednesday. "This will be a real tribute to my son," she said. Moosewala was shot dead on May 29.

155.title: Mithali had been in form longer than some of her teammates had been alive: Jaffer
155.article_body: After Mithali Raj announced her retirement from all forms of international cricket, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Towards the end of her career, Mithali had been in form longer than some of her teammates had been alive." He added, "That's how long she served Indian cricket. Congratulations and thank you @M_Raj03...Good luck for your second innings."

156.title: Took 10 yrs to turn dream into reality: Ayan Mukerji on 'Brahmastra'
156.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, speaking about his upcoming film 'Brahmastra', has said, "'Brahmastra' began in 2011 itself and since then it took me 10 years for us to convert the dream into reality." He added, "The film's inspiration is from our mythology but it is based on today's world." The film features Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

157.title: Her heart is more beautiful than face: Twinkle on mother Dimple's b'day
157.article_body: Twinkle Khanna wished her mother and veteran actress Dimple Kapadia on her 65th birthday. Sharing an old picture with her mother on Instagram, Twinkle wrote, "The birthday girl's heart is even more beautiful than her face. Happy Birthday, Mom!" Twinkle's younger sister Rinke Khanna can also be seen in the picture. Dimple made her Bollywood debut in 1973 with 'Bobby'.

158.title: RBI raises inflation projection for FY23 from 5.7% to 6.7%
158.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Russia-Ukraine war "has led to globalisation of inflation" and announced RBI's decision to raise FY23 inflation projection from 5.7% to 6.7%. "Inflationary pressures have become broad-based and remain largely driven by adverse supply shocks," Das said. RBI's Monetary Policy Committee said inflation is likely to remain above 6% in FY23's first three quarters.

159.title: Centre releases ₹126.7 crore to states for modernisation of police
159.article_body: Centre released ₹126.7 crore to various states for the modernisation of police forces, construction of fortified police stations and other projects. Union Home Ministry disbursed ₹22.59 crore to Chhattisgarh, ₹14.76 crore to Odisha and ₹2.63 crore to Jharkhand under the Security Related Expenditure scheme. A total of ₹7.5 crore was disbursed to Maharashtra under Special Central Assistance scheme.

160.title: I kept in touch with him: Warner on Finch's form in IPL 2022
160.article_body: Australia opener David Warner has revealed he was in touch with his opening partner Aaron Finch during the IPL 2022 and had conversations regarding his technique. "I just said to him not to walk out into the ball," stated Warner. Referring to Finch's unbeaten 61-run innings against Sri Lanka, Warner said, "He's at his best when he's nice and still."

161.title: Telangana BJP MLA booked for hurting religious sentiments
161.article_body: Telangana BJP MLA Raja Singh has been booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments of a community. He allegedly made derogatory remarks against Ajmer Sharif Dargah. The complainant, a resident of Hyderabad, said that a video of Singh making an offensive statement was viral on social media. The police said the authenticity of the video is yet to be confirmed.

162.title: BJP MLA denies revealing identity of Hyderabad gang-rape victim
162.article_body: BJP MLA Raghunandan Rao, who has been booked for revealing the identity of the 17-year-old gang-rape victim in Jubilee Hills, has denied releasing her videos and photos. "These are only rumours as I haven't done anything like this," he said. Rao added, "I don't have any connection with the AIMIM, but Congress and TRS have," he said.

163.title: PMC to pay ₹35 lakh for land to create alternate airport route
163.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will pay a deposit of ₹35 lakh for 2,350 square metres of defence land to create an alternate road to reach the airport from Viman Nagar. "The new alternate route...will be more beneficial for...flyers...coming out from the new terminal building," said Santosh Dhoke, Pune Airport Director. The construction of the alternate route is partially complete.

164.title: 2 women & a man attack, injure traffic police personnel after being stopped in Delhi
164.article_body: A Delhi Traffic Police personnel was injured on being assaulted by a man and two women who were reportedly stopped for triple-riding on a motorcycle on the wrong side of the road. The video shows the personnel being dragged by his collar. As per police, he sustained head injuries. One of the women alleged misconduct by the personnel.

165.title: Have 'solid evidence' against accused in Hyd gang-rape case: Police
165.article_body: The Hyderabad Police investigating the gang-rape of a 17-year-old girl in Jubilee Hills said it has "solid evidence" against the accused. Police have put together the sequence of events after watching CCTV footage for over 12 hours, said Police Commissioner CV Anand. "A few loose ends remain but otherwise we have solid evidence against the accused," he said.

166.title: Starc cuts index finger on shoe spike while bowling, ruled out of 2nd SL T20I
166.article_body: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc has reportedly been ruled out of the second T20I against Sri Lanka due to a finger injury. Starc had slit the index finger of his bowling hand on his shoe spike during the first over of the first T20I. He completed his overs despite the injury, recording figures of 3/26 as Australia won by 10 wickets.

167.title: Central Bank Digital Currency will be introduced this fiscal: RBI
167.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar on Wednesday said the Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC), also known as digital rupee, will be introduced in fiscal year 2022-23. Process of introduction of CBDC will be gradual to avoid any impact on the financial and banking system, Sankar added. Introduction of CBDC was announced in Union Budget 2022.

168.title: NCPCR summons Alappuzha SP over child raising hate slogans at PFI rally
168.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has summoned Alappuzha SP over a minor child who was allegedly seen raising provocative slogans at a Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Kerala. The NCPCR has also sought detailed action taken report from the police by June 14. The commission had earlier sought registration of FIR against those responsible.

169.title: Raj Cong MLA accuses BJP, Subhash Chandra of horse-trading; seeks FIR
169.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA Mahendra Choudhary sought an FIR against BJP leaders, including state BJP president Satish Poonia, and independent candidate Subhash Chandra for alleged horse-trading attempts ahead of Rajya Sabha polls. BJP and Chandra are trying to win by misusing central agencies like ED, Choudhary alleged. This comes after Chandra claimed that eight MLAs will cross vote in his favour.

170.title: India could be $20 trillion economy by 2040, says Chief Economic Advisor
170.article_body: If the dollar GDP doubles every seven years, India will be at $20 trillion GDP by 2040 with per capita income close to $15,000, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran said. "India is forecasted by IMF to cross $5 trillion by 2026-27," he stated. "Indian economy is...[in] much better place than many others in the world to face...challenges," Nageswaran added.

171.title: Julia Garner offered role of Madonna in singer's biopic: Report
171.article_body: Actress Julia Garner has been offered the role of Madonna in the singer's upcoming biopic, a report by Variety stated.  The report added Garner's team is expected to accept the offer for the role. "The focus of this film will always be music. Music has kept me going and art has kept me alive," Madonna stated while announcing her film.

172.title: Felt really nice meeting such a legend: Umran on his 1st training session
172.article_body: Recalling his first day of India's training session where he met head coach Rahul Dravid, pacer Umran Malik said, "I felt really nice meeting such a legend. He told me to keep continuing what I'm doing." He added, "I was really excited for the first day...Was positive that I would bowl well in the nets...Everyone here [is] like a brother."

173.title: Decayed human head found in Delhi, police say can't identify or know gender
173.article_body: A decayed human head has been found in Delhi. This comes days after decomposed body parts with missing head and torso were found in the same area. Police said immediately ascertaining the identity and gender of the deceased is not possible. Police added that the head may be of the same person whose body parts were found earlier.

174.title: Ukraine to launch 'Book of Executioners' to record Russian war crimes
