349.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday for posing as a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang and making a threat call to the chairman of a private school in Gurugram, police said. Upset over failing his class 10th examination in 2019, the accused threatened to kidnap and murder the chairman of Guru Dronacharya School JP Yadav, Gurugram Police said.

350.title: Pune court sends man held for Lashkar-e-Taiba links to judicial custody
350.article_body: A Pune court on Tuesday sent Mohammed Junaid Mohammed Ata, who was arrested for his alleged involvement in funding and recruitment for Lashkar-e-Taiba, to judicial custody. The 28-year-old had been working at a scrap dealer shop in Dapodi. The Maharashtra Anti Terrorism Squad (ATS) had arrested him on May 23.

351.title: I pity women in your life: Swara to troll saying 'Amber deserved that'
351.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker reacted to a troll who tweeted, "I like you but Heard deserved that," after she shared an article about the Amber Heard-Johnny Depp defamation case. She responded, "Nobody deserves to be sexually assaulted...I pity the women in your life." Swara also shared a 2020 article on Depp losing his libel case against The Sun's "wife-beater" claim.

352.title: College student fights off robber who molested her on Mumbai train
352.article_body: A 20-year-old college student fought her molester off and got him arrested after he tried to rob her inside a local train in Mumbai on Monday. The accused had boarded the ladies' compartment and tried to snatch the woman's bag when she was waiting to get off the train. In the scuffle, both of them fell off the stationary train.

353.title: 23 K'taka students suspended for staging protest to wear hijab
353.article_body: The Uppinangady Government First Grade College management suspended 23 girl students, who staged a protest demanding permission to wear hijab inside classrooms last week. The Karnataka High Court in March stated that the hijab isn't an essential religious practice in Islam, making it mandatory for everyone to wear uniforms provided by the educational institutions.

354.title: Ukraine must not be pressured into a bad peace deal, says UK PM
354.article_body: British PM Boris Johnson has said that Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy must not be pressured by world powers into accepting a bad peace deal with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The world must avoid any outcome where Putin's unwarranted aggression appears to have paid off, he added. Johnson also said that Britain would "remain at the forefront" of support for Ukraine.

355.title: Delhi Metro extends train timings for India-SA T20 match spectators
355.article_body: Delhi Metro has extended timings of last trains on all lines except the Airport Express Line to facilitate spectators during the India-South Africa T20 match. Delhi Metro will be performing nearly 48 extra trips by extending its last trains' timings by about 30-45 minutes on June 9. Last train on Violet Line from Kashmere Gate will start at 12:00 am.

356.title: Delhi Police bust illegal arms gang, seize 10 country-made pistols
356.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police busted an illegal arms gang and arrested one person, said an official release on Tuesday. Police recovered five semi-automatic pistols, 10 country-made pistols and four live cartridges from his possession. The gang is involved in supplying illegal arms and ammunition in Delhi-NCR and Western Uttar Pradesh, according to the Delhi Police.

357.title: Salman's statement recorded over death threat letter, actor denies dispute with anyone
357.article_body: Mumbai Police has recorded the statement of actor Salman Khan in connection with a letter threatening him and his father, an official said on Tuesday. In his statement, he denied threat from any person, threat calls or a dispute with anyone in the recent past. Police had earlier enhanced the security around the actor's residence in Bandra.

358.title: Theme park exclusively for women, kids inaugurated in Hyderabad
358.article_body: A theme park built exclusively for women and children has been inaugurated at Kukatpally Housing Board Colony (KPHB)-Phase 3 in Hyderabad. Only women and children under the age of 10 years are allowed in the park. It has dedicated play areas for children, an open gym, walking paths, a yoga space and an area exclusively marked for kitty parties.

359.title: YouTuber Roddur Roy arrested for 'derogatory' remarks against Mamata
359.article_body: YouTuber Roddur Roy was arrested in Goa on Tuesday for allegedly making derogatory remarks against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Roy will be brought to Kolkata on transit remand, a senior police official said. He had reportedly made the remarks during a Facebook live programme, following which TMC spokesperson Riju Dutta had filed a complaint against him.

360.title: Request media not to associate public appeal with us: Sidhu's family
360.article_body: Late Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's family has requested the media not to associate any public appeals with them amid his murder investigation. "Whatever appeal will be made on behalf of Sidhu's family will be done via his official Instagram handle," their statement read in Punjabi. Sidhu was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on May 29.

361.title: Bicycle thief arrested in Navi Mumbai, 25 stolen bicycles seized
361.article_body: The Panvel city police arrested a 35-year-old bicycle thief and recovered over 25 stolen bicycles from him. Police said the accused, Dinesh Ramdas Jadhav, was a porter in a market and started stealing bicycles to make extra money. A team under Senior Inspector Vijay Kadbane worked on the modus operandi and with a tip-off, arrested the accused, the police said.

362.title: Mumbai won't flood even if it rains at 60-70 mm/hour: BMC official
362.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Additional Municipal Commissioner P Velrasu has said that even if Mumbai receives rain at the rate of 60 to 70 mm per hour, there will be no waterlogging. However, if the rainfall exceeds this limit, there will be flooding, he added. BMC has dealt with 73% of flooding spots in the city, Velrasu said.

363.title: CBIC to destroy 42,000 kgs of narcotics across 14 locations on Wed
363.article_body: The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has announced that it'll destroy about 42,000 kilograms of narcotics as part of its 'Drug Destruction Day' on Wednesday. The narcotics will be destroyed across 14 locations in the country. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will virtually witness the destruction in Guwahati, Lucknow, Mumbai, Mundra, Kandla, Patna and Siliguri.

364.title: Delhi to witness ongoing heatwave till June 9: IMD
364.article_body: Delhi will witness the ongoing heatwave at isolated places till June 9 and the temperature will remain between 44-46°C, IMD Senior Scientist RK Jenamani said. Cloudy conditions and drizzle is expected on June 11 over northwest India and parts of central India due to a western disturbance. He added that the heatwave will abate from June 11.

365.title: Nitin Gadkari, other Union ministers seen in bus at Patna airport
365.article_body: Union minister Nitin Gadkari's office took to Twitter to share a picture of him sitting in a bus at Patna's Jay Prakash Narayan International Airport, along with Union ministers Ashwini Kumar Choubey and Shandilya Giriraj Singh, among others. Gadkari is on a one-day visit to Bihar. Bihar Deputy CMs Tarkishore Prasad and Renu Devi were also seen in the picture.

366.title: Man shoots estranged wife dead in alimony dispute in Pune
366.article_body: A 45-year-old man allegedly shot dead his estranged wife and injured his mother-in-law following a dispute over alimony in Pune district's Shirur, police said on Tuesday. The accused, Dipak Dhawale, who travelled to Shirur for a court hearing, opened fire at the victim and her mother. Dhawale fled in an auto after the shooting but was nabbed by police.

367.title: Man destroys ₹40 cr in rare museum artifacts after fight with girlfriend in US
367.article_body: A 21-year-old man in US broke into the Dallas Museum of Art and destroyed ancient antiquities worth a total of $5 million (around ₹40.37 crore) after a fight with his girlfriend, police said. A sixth-century Greek statue and a pot dating back to 450 BC were among items destroyed by Brian Hernandez. He was caught smashing them using a stool.

368.title: Maharashtra Board to announce Class 12 result at 1 pm tomorrow
368.article_body: The Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education will announce the Class 12 result on Wednesday. Minister for School Education Varsha Gaikwad said the result will be declared at 1 pm. After the online examination for the last two years due to COVID-19, students appeared for the exam offline this year.

369.title: COVID trying to crawl back into our lives: Sonnalli on testing +ve
369.article_body: Actress Sonnalli Seygall announced on Tuesday that she tested positive for COVID-19. She wrote in a social media post, "Finally after 2 yrs I have contracted the virus. I am isolating and recovering. This msg is also a reminder that covid is trying to crawl back into our lives, so mask up guys!" Earlier, actor Kartik Aaryan tested COVID-19 positive.

370.title: Want to see who's selling golgappas in train: Sanjay Gupta on 'Laal..' scene
370.article_body: Talking about a scene where Aamir Khan can be seen eating a golgappa in the trailer of his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', director Sanjay Gupta tweeted, "I'm dying to see...who is selling golgappas in a moving train." 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is a remake of Tom Hanks' 1994 American film 'Forrest Gump' and also stars Kareena Kapoor, Naga Chaitanya, Sharman Joshi.

371.title: Wanted to build something from scratch: Stoinis on signing for LSG in IPL
371.article_body: Revealing the "big reason" behind signing for debutants LSG in IPL 2022, all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said he wanted to build something from scratch. "Have a blank canvas to work with, in...company of someone like KL Rahul and Sanjiv Goenka to build something that you can look back on in 10-15 years," he added. LSG lost in the Eliminator to RCB.

372.title: Diljit offered me Honsla Rakh, Shehnaaz ended up doing it: Nimrit Kaur Ahluwalia
372.article_body: Nimrit Kaur Ahluwalia revealed that she was offered a role in Diljit Dosanjh-starrer 'Honsla Rakh' while she was working on the show 'Choti Sarrdaarni'. "It was Diljit sir who'd reached out himself...He texted me...and asked if I'd test for a part," she said, adding, "Shehnaaz (Gill) ended up doing it...Lot of things didn't work out, COVID was at its peak."

373.title: Ukraine must demine its coast for grain to be exported: Russia
373.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said Ukraine must demine the approaches to its ports in order for ships to be cleared by Russian military before they could export grain, Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters. Russia has blockaded Ukrainian ports, disrupting the export of grains from Ukraine. Earlier, Ukraine accused Russia of stealing grain from occupied areas and selling it.

374.title: Right now he is Australia's best T20I fast bowler: Watson on Hazlewood
374.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson named Josh Hazlewood as Australia's best T20I pacer currently, saying it's amazing to see his evolution as a T20I bowler over the last two years. "Always thought he was just a Test and one-day bowler because he didn't have that many defensive options in T20 cricket," he added. Hazlewood has taken 40 T20I wickets so far.

375.title: Fan in Lalu Yadav's room in Jharkhand catches fire, none injured
375.article_body: A fire broke out in a room of the circuit house in Jharkhand's Palamu where RJD chief and former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav was staying, officials said. Prasad was having breakfast in his room when the fan caught fire due to a short circuit, they added. The fire was immediately doused by his aides and no one sustained injuries.

376.title: Prophet remarks not made by any govt functionary, no impact on govt: Goyal
376.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said that remarks against Prophet Muhammad by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma do not have any impact on the government. "I don't think that this statement was made by any government functionary and therefore it has no impact on the government and necessary action has been taken by the party," Goyal added.

377.title: Number of Left Wing Extremism-hit districts down by 70% since 2014: Shah
377.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that the number of districts affected by Left Wing Extremism (LWE) has declined by 70% since 2014. "The government also lifted the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA) from more than 66% [of the] area in the Northeast," he added. Separately, Shah inaugurated the National Tribal Research Institute (NTRI) in Delhi today.

378.title: 2 killed, 1 severely injured after house wall collapses in Gujarat
378.article_body: Two people died and one was severely injured after the wall of an old dilapidated house collapsed on them in Gujarat's Sabarkantha district. The incident occurred on Tuesday when Babu Patel was getting his new residence constructed adjacent to his old house. While Babu and 28-year-old labourer Harsh Barada were declared dead, the other labourer suffered injuries, an official said.

379.title: 133 gold coins, ₹2.8cr cash found in raid on Delhi minister & his aide; pics released
379.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has found 133 gold coins weighing 1.8 kg and ₹2.85 crore in cash during a raid conducted on the premises of arrested Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aide. The seized cash and gold were acquired from unexplained sources, ED said. Various incriminating documents and digital records were also found, it added.

380.title: Artefacts from Ukraine invasion displayed at museum in Kyiv
380.article_body: Artefacts recovered from ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine are being shown to visitors at a museum in Kyiv. Items including missiles, food rations and helmets, along with personal notes and credit cards of Russian soldiers killed on the frontlines have been put on display. "You can see and touch the war with your fingertips here," curator Yuriy Savchuk said.

381.title: Originally planned to have wedding with Nayanthara in Tirupati: Vignesh
381.article_body: Filmmaker Vignesh Shivan said that he and actress Nayanthara had originally planned their wedding to be held in Tirupati. "We were even ready to make arrangements, but we felt it won't work out logistically. Therefore, we decided to have it in Chennai. It's a close-knit ceremony with family members and close friends," he added.

382.title: Noida Police rescues 2 girls from Jharkhand trafficked as housemaids
382.article_body: Two minor sisters who were trafficked as housemaids in Noida have been rescued by the police, officials said on Monday. Notably, a couple in Noida had employed them through an agency. "The police had inputs that the girls were kept as slaves and forcefully made to work in the household...after which the action was taken," a police spokesperson said.

383.title: Chennai woman kills self after losing money in online gambling
383.article_body: A 29-year-old woman died by suicide in Chennai on Sunday after she allegedly lost money on an online gaming platform. According to the police, the woman, Bhavani, had a habit of playing online rummy for the past one-and-a-half years and had begun investing more in past four months after initially earning profit. She had reportedly lost over ₹10 lakh.

384.title: Policybazaar-owner PB Fintech shares crash over 15% on CEO's stake sale plan
384.article_body: Shares of PB Fintech, which owns Policybazaar, crashed over 15% in Tuesday’s intraday trade after its CEO Yashish Dahiya proposed to sell around 37 lakh shares through the open market. The shares hit an intraday low of ₹557 on the BSE, 15.4% down from its previous close, while on NSE it touched ₹556, 15.6% down from its previous close.

385.title: For 15 days after heart surgery, I became extremely humble: Sunil Grover
385.article_body: Actor Sunil Grover stated that he became extremely humble and full of gratitude for 15 days after his heart surgery, having suffered a heart attack. "I had become very sweet," added Sunil. Discussing the lessons he has learnt, Sunil stated, "If you can drink water when you want [and] sit up on your bed by yourself, you are lucky."

386.title: Talk isn't a problem, casteism is: Dalit activist after Google cancels her talk
386.article_body: Dalit rights activist Thenmozhi Soundararajan, whose talk on caste bias was cancelled by Google, said a talk on casteism isn't the problem, casteism itself is. "Every part of Google's reaction (to the talk) reflects that they need to do caste equity," Soundararajan said. "I just wish Google had given us the chance to show them the other way," she added.

387.title: K'taka BJP will face 2023 polls under collective leadership: Yediyurappa
387.article_body: BJP leader and former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Tuesday said the 2023 Assembly elections in the state will be fought under 'collective leadership'. "As voters are with PM Narendra Modi and...BJP, there will be no hurdles in our path towards victory," he said. Yediyurappa added that he is committed to travelling across the state to strengthen the party.

388.title: Inclusion is firm foundation underlying our constitutional architecture: VP Naidu
388.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu said that underlying our constitutional architecture is the firm foundation of "inclusion", of leaving no one behind. "It is the vision that finds an echo in the overarching philosophy of the present government, led by Prime Minister Modi that believes in 'sabka sath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas and sabka prayas'," he added.

389.title: Man from Tamil Nadu held for threatening to blow up 6 RSS offices
389.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has arrested a man from Tamil Nadu for threatening to blow up at least six RSS offices, including two in Uttar Pradesh. The ATS will bring the suspect to Lucknow on transit remand. A man associated with RSS was added to a WhatsApp group, where a discussion regarding the bomb blasts was underway, police said.

390.title: Man who disguised himself as Moosewala's fan & clicked selfie among 8 arrested
390.article_body: Punjab Police have arrested 8 people so far in connection with murder of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. A man who disguised himself as a fan and clicked selfies with Sidhu Moosewala and shared information with the shooters has also been arrested. SIT has also identified four shooters of Sidhu Moosewala.

391.title: NCW takes cognisance of Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case
391.article_body: National Commission for Women Chairperson Rekha Sharma on Tuesday said that the commission has taken cognisance of Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case. A 17-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped when she was returning home after a party in the Jubilee Hills area on May 28. "The matter is serious because minor girls are being targeted," she said.

392.title: Amije Forever Tomar: Kartik as 'Bhool...' crosses ₹200-cr mark globally
392.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, taking to Instagram on Monday, shared box office figures of his latest film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. In his post, he mentioned that the horror-comedy film has earned more than ₹200 crore at the worldwide box office and ₹154.82 crore in the Indian market. "Amije Forever Tomar (I am forever yours)," Kartik wrote.

393.title: Russian envoy walks out of UN meeting as EU blames Moscow for food crisis
393.article_body: Russia's UN ambassador walked out of a UN Security Council meeting after European Council President Charles Michel blamed Moscow's invasion of Ukraine for causing a global food crisis. Michel said Russia's using food supplies as "stealth missile against developing countries". "You may leave the room, maybe it's easier not to listen to...truth," Michel told Vassily Nebenzia as he walked out.

394.title: Not afraid: Mamata on terrorist group KLO chief's reported threats
394.article_body: After banned terrorist group Kamatapur Liberation Organization (KLO) chief reportedly threatened West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee with a "bloodbath" if she opposed the group's demand for a separate state, she responded by saying, "Some people are threatening me, I'm not afraid." In a purported video message to Banerjee, KLO chief had said, "Beware. Don't step on the soil of Kamatapur."

395.title: Chaddis do chaddi work: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah on RSS
395.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised RSS saying "chaddis do chaddi work" and asked why the post of the organisation's chief has never been occupied by a Dalit. "I am telling you from the beginning that RSS is a non-secular organisation," he said. Siddaramaiah is talking about such things because he doesn't have any other subject, said Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai.

396.title: Pakistan asks Qatar for more LNG amid fuel crisis: Report
396.article_body: Pakistan has asked Qatar for additional shipments of Liquified Natural Gas (LNG) amid its ongoing fuel crunch, Bloomberg has reported quoting sources. This comes amid recent reports that the Pakistani government was mulling reducing the number of working days in a bid to conserve fuel and foreign exchange. Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves have reportedly fallen below $10 billion.

397.title: Ajay shares fans' comments for 'Legend of Bhagat...' on film's 20th anniversary
397.article_body: Ajay Devgn on Tuesday marked the 20th anniversary of 'The Legend of Bhagat Singh' by sharing a series of fan comments about the film on his Instagram account. "This movie will always be close to my heart," a fan wrote, while another commented, "Got...tears while watching...[it]." "Even after 20 years...#TheLegendOfBhagatSingh remains a film...I'm proud to have associated with," Ajay wrote.

398.title: SEBI may use US casinos-like AI tech against insider trading: Report
398.article_body: SEBI is in talks with a US-based AI firm to develop Vegas casinos-like AI tech to catch insider trading, Economic Times reported citing sources. If the deal goes through, the company will customise the software according to the requirements of SEBI. The company has given a live demonstration to SEBI as to how the software will work.

399.title: Congress aims to politicise textbook issue: K’taka Education Minister
399.article_body: Amid the textbook issue in the state, Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said Congress aims to "politicise" the textbook issue for elections. "For the last 65 years, they were teaching false things to the students," Nagesh added. "Congress, everyday, is coming down. Whatever false agenda they have given to the people, it is coming out now," he stated.

400.title: Cong burning RSS chaddi as theirs has been stripped: Pralhad Joshi
400.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Tuesday said Congress is "burning RSS chaddi (knicker)...because people have stripped [Congress'] chaddis". This comes after Congress' youth wing NSUI set fire to a pair of RSS knickers to protest against "saffronisation" of school textbooks in Karnataka. People have taken Congress' chaddis off in front of the entire country in Uttar Pradesh, Joshi added.

401.title: 1 booked for insulting national flag ahead of Kejriwal's Guj rally
401.article_body: Police have registered an FIR against an unidentified person for allegedly insulting the national flag ahead of AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's roadshow in Gujarat. A video has surfaced in which the accused was purportedly seen putting his feet on the Tricolour on a roadside, where some flags were kept for distribution to AAP supporters, police said.

402.title: Syria claims Israel fired missiles at its military sites
402.article_body: Syria has claimed that Israeli forces fired multiple missiles at its military sites south of Damascus. It added that the attack caused some material damage but there were no casualties as it shot down most of the missiles. UK-based war monitor Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said that the missiles targeted sites where pro-Iran Shiite militias are located.
